intro: Lygistum album, commonly known as the white snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces a toxic sap that can be harmful to livestock and even humans if ingested. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in shaded environments. Due to its toxicity, it is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
